EN

The provided text outlines insights from two executive interviews conducted at FMLS:25. First, Dor Eligula of BridgeWise discusses the integration of AI into investment research, highlighting significant growth opportunities in Asian markets and the importance of balancing automation with human judgment to ensure accuracy. He also provides practical advice for retail investors on how to utilize AI tools without falling into common traps. The second interview features Brendan Callan, CEO of TRADU, who recently won a debate arguing that the Prop Trading model is detrimental to the industry. Callan critiques the current model for being overly dependent on fees, having loose risk management protocols, and creating confusion for retail audiences, while explaining the factors that contributed to its recent expansion.

Key Points

  • Dor Eligula of BridgeWise highlights AI integration in investment research and growth potential in Asian markets.
  • Eligula emphasizes the synergy between automation and human oversight in financial analysis.
  • Brendan Callan, CEO of TRADU, argues against the Prop Trading model, criticizing its fee dependency and risk management.
  • Callan won a debate at FMLS:25 regarding the negative impact of Prop Trading on the industry.

Article
